TI Metal-insulator transition in the S=1/2 spin ladder system
   (Sr0.4Ca0.6)(14)Cu24-xCoxO(41-delta)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Symposium on Frontiers of High -T(c) Superconductivity
CY OCT 27-29, 1995
CL MORIOKA, JAPAN
ID SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; GAPS; SRCU2O3
AB We have confirmed that the (Sr0.4Ca0.6)(14)Cu24-xCoxO41-delta system with x = 0 has a spin gap of 735 K from NMR measurement. This system shows a metal-insulator transition at Co content x between 2.9 and 4.5 after high-pressure O-2 annealing (650 degrees C, 8 MPa, 20 h). The behavior of the electrical resistivity for the high-pressure O-2 annealed sample with x = 4.8 can be characterized by the one-dimensional variable range hopping scheme at low temperature. These facts can be interpreted as the trapped hole carriers in the 1D CuO2 chain being released into the ladder by Co doping x above 2.9 under high-pressure O-2 annealing.

TI Electron paramagnetic resonance governed by the Dzyaloshinsky-Moriya
   antisymmetric exchange interaction in CuGeO3
SO JOURNAL OF PHYSICS-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article
ID KCUF3
AB Several reports of electron paramagnetic resonance experiments performed on the spin-Peierls compound CuGeO3 have appeared so far, but none of them have precisely explained the origin of the line broadening and the temperature dependence of both the linewidth and the resonance field, all of which differ from those of conventional one-dimensional Heisenberg antiferromagnets in which the dipolar or anisotropic exchange interaction brings about line broadening. In the present report, it is clarified that the antisymmetric exchange interaction, Sigma(i)d(ii+1).(S-i x S-i+1) with d(ii+1) perpendicular to c-axis (magnetic chain), between nearest-neighbour Cu spins on the c-axis governs all factors which characterize the EPR line of CuGeO3, i.e., the value and the angular dependence of the linewidth at high temperatures where the short-range order is completely absent, the temperature dependence of the linewidth, and the resonance field, as well as the high-temperature lineshape. The present conclusion indicates that the crystal symmetry of this compound is lower than that given by the space group Pbmm which was reported by Vollenkle et al in 1967, because the symmetry Pbmm does not allow the antisymmetric exchange interaction mentioned above.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.

TI Lattice anomaly and dynamics of CuGeO3
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4th International Conference on Phonon Physics/8th International
   Conference on Phonon Scattering in Condensed Matter (PHONONS 95)
CY JUL 23-28, 1995
CL SAPPORO, JAPAN
SP Japan Soc Appl Phys, Int Union Pure & Appl Phys, Commemorat Assoc Japan World Exposit 1970, Inoue Sci Fdn, Int Commun Fdn, Murata Sci Fdn
AB We have performed neutron scattering on both single crystal and powder samples of spin-Peierls system CuGeO3. Below the transition temperature T-sp, we found spontaneous strains in all crystal axes. Temperature dependence of the lattice constants and phonon density of states change drastically well above T-sp, which is apparently linked with the transition. Thus, we concluded that inherent structural instability makes a favorable condition for the SP transition and also continuous transformation affects magnetic behavior above T-sp.

TI Raman scattering of CuGeO3
SO PHYSICA B-CONDENSED MATTER
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 4th International Conference on Phonon Physics/8th International
   Conference on Phonon Scattering in Condensed Matter (PHONONS 95)
CY JUL 23-28, 1995
CL SAPPORO, JAPAN
SP Japan Soc Appl Phys, Int Union Pure & Appl Phys, Commemorat Assoc Japan World Exposit 1970, Inoue Sci Fdn, Int Commun Fdn, Murata Sci Fdn
AB Detailed temperature dependence of Raman scattering spectra of CuGeO3 has been measured in the temperature region between 4.2 and 30 K, to clarify the anomaly of phonons and magnetic excitations in the vicinity of spin-Peierls (SP) transition at 14 K. Among the five Raman peaks, which appear in the SP state, only a peak at 230 cm(-1) remains above SP transition temperature. Judging from the line shape, this peak can be assigned to be an ordinary two-magnon excitation of antiferromagnets.

TI Tunneling spectroscopy of the superconducting energy gap in RNi(2)B(2)C
   (R=Y and Lu)
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID TRANSITION
AB Superconducting energy gap in RNi(2)B(2)C (R=Y and Lu) has been investigated using a break-junction tunneling technique. The observed differential conductance dI/dV is well described by the BCS density of states with a small lifetime broadening parameter. We have found small gap values for the local low-T-c phases in addition to the bulk T-c of 15.6-16.6 K. The gap value of 2 Delta = 4.5 meV with T-c = 15 K gives the BCS ratio of 2 Delta/k(B)T(c) = 3.5, which is kept constant down to the observed lowest T-c of 4.6 K. These results give clear evidence for the BCS mechanism of superconductivity for these compounds.

TI The magnetic field dependence of the low temperature (0.1K to 3K)
   residual specific heat of Pr2-xCexCuO4-delta
SO CZECHOSLOVAK JOURNAL OF PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 21st International Conference on Low Temperature Physics (LT 21)
CY AUG 08-14, 1996
CL PRAGUE, CZECH REPUBLIC
SP Int Union Pure & Appl Phys
AB Measurements are presented of the low temperature specific heat of three polycrystalline samples of Pr2-zCezCuO4 in magnetic fields of 0, 2 and 4 Tesla. The residual specific heat contribution in sere field seems to have a form alpha T-n (n < 1) for all of the samples, whether superconducting or non-superconducting. The behaviour in magnetic fields is similar to that reported for other high Tc superconductors where a change in exponent of the residual term occurs at some crossover temperature in magnetic fields.

TI Quantum effect on magnetic excitation
SO CZECHOSLOVAK JOURNAL OF PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 21st International Conference on Low Temperature Physics (LT 21)
CY AUG 08-14, 1996
CL PRAGUE, CZECH REPUBLIC
SP Int Union Pure & Appl Phys
ID SPIN-PEIERLS TRANSITION; CUGEO3
AB Inelastic neutron scattering have been performed on the spin-Peierls compound CuGeO3 in order to investigate the quantum effect on the magnetic excitation. In one-dimensional Heisenberg antiferromagnet system with S=1/2, the quantum effect is so strong that there is no long range order, and the existence of so-called 'Spin Wave Continuum' above the des Cloizeaux-Pearson mode can be expected In this work, the whole spectrum of the magnetic excitation in the Brillouin zone has been firstly elucidated and it has made clear the quantum effect on the ground-state of the spin-Peierls system.

TI Raman scattering of CuGeO3 and Y2BaNiO5
SO CZECHOSLOVAK JOURNAL OF PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 21st International Conference on Low Temperature Physics (LT 21)
CY AUG 08-14, 1996
CL PRAGUE, CZECH REPUBLIC
SP Int Union Pure & Appl Phys
ID PHASE
AB Raman scattering and infrared absorption spectra of CuGeO3 and Y2BaNiO5 have been measured. CuGuO(3) is a typical inorganic spin-Peierls system with S=1/2 and Y2BaNiO5 is a recently discovered Haldane system with S=1. Two magnon excitation along the c*-axis is found for CuGeO3. Additional two-magnon excitations due to one dimensional fluctuation are observed for both system. For CuGeO3 the mode at about 30cm(-1) is the soft mode due to the lattice distortion, not due to the spill gap. The normal mode calculations for CuGeO3 show that the crystal structure is stabilized by the Ge-O frame.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV, DEPT PHYS, SETAGAYA KU, TOKYO 157, JAPAN.
RP Ogita, N (reprint author), HIROSHIMA UNIV, FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI, HIGASHIHIROSHIMA 739, JAPAN.

TI Metal-insulator transition in the S=1/2 spin ladder system
   (Sr0.4Ca0.6)(14)Cu24-xCoxO41-delta
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; PRESSURE; TC
AB We have found that the (Sr0.4Ca0.6)(14)Cu24-xCoxO41-delta system shows a metal-insulator transition at Co content x between 4.0 and 4.5 after high-pressure O-2 annealing. For the as-sintered samples the T dependence of the electrical resistivities is semiconducting over the whole x range and the associated activation energies systematically increase with increasing x. For the high-pressure O-2 annealed samples the T dependence of the electrical resistivities is semiconducting, similar to the as-sintered ones at x below 3.8, whereas the electrical resistivities scarcely depend on the temperature variation with two types of small activation energies, similar to 59 meV (200-100 K) and similar to 2 meV (100-4.2 K) at x = 4.8. The behaviors of the. electrical resistivities are characterized by the one-dimensional variable-range hopping scheme at a low-temperature region. These facts can be interpreted: the hole carriers beyond the capacity of the 1D CuO2 chain for trapping holes are released into the ladder by Co doping x above 2.9 under high-pressure O-2 annealing (650 degrees C, 8 MPa, 20 h).
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI STRUCTURAL PHASE-TRANSITION OF SR2CUO2(CO3)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE; SUPERCONDUCTOR; OXYCARBONATE
AB The structural phase transition of Sr2CuO2(CO3) has been studied by X-ray and neutron powder diffraction and phonon Raman scattering. The crystal structure at room temperature is tetragonal with space group of <I(4)over bar> (S-4(2)) and the lattice parameters a = 7.8045(1) Angstrom and c = 14.993(1) Angstrom. The structural phase-transition temperature determined by X-ray powder diffraction is found at 490 K. The structure above this transition temperature is tetragonal P42(1)2 (D-2(4)), and the lattice parameters are a = 5.54364(8) Angstrom and c = 7.53823(11) Angstrom at 573 K. The neutron-diffraction data are refined by a Rietveld analysis and these structural parameters for below and above the transition temperature are presented. Raman spectra of Sr2CuO2(CO3) have been measured in the temperature region between 5 K and 593 K. In the temperature region between 5 K and 483 K, a new extra mode was not observed, but the peak intensity of the strongest mode at 480 cm(-1) was decreased from room temperature to 373 K. Above 490 K, a new peak has been observed at 160 cm(-1) and the weak peaks which are observed at room temperature disappear. Judging from the facts that the spectral shape and line width originating from the CO3 slab change at the transition temperature but a soft mode has not been observed, the type of this phase transition is order-disorder due to the change of the CO3 alignments.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI Pressure effects on the dimerization in the spin-Peierls state of CuGeO3
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID TRANSITION
AB The dimerization in the spin-Peierls state of CuGeO3 has been studied by neutron diffraction under high pressures up to 1.65 GPa. Effects of pressure on the chain direction along the c axis are fairly small; however, the dimerization of Cu along this direction tends to decrease. In comparison with this small change, the effects on the oxygen displacements in the ab plane are rather large. The shift of oxygen atoms decreases also along the a axis; on the other hand, the shift along the b axis increases. These characteristic changes in the dimerization together with those in the bond lengths and bond angles are briefly discussed in connection with the large enhancement of the transition temperature T-sp and also with the decrease in the exchange energy J which were recently observed under high pressure.

TI ELECTRONIC-STRUCTURE OF PRNIO3 STUDIED BY PHOTOEMISSION AND
   X-RAY-ABSORPTION SPECTROSCOPY - BAND-GAP AND ORBITAL ORDERING
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID TRANSITION-METAL COMPOUNDS; INSULATOR-TRANSITION; SPECTRA; VALENCE;
   OXIDES; DIHALIDES; NACUO2; STATES; MODEL; ND
AB The electronic structure of PrNiO3 has been studied by photoemission and x-ray-absorption spectroscopy. By analyzing the spectra using configuration-interaction calculations on a NiO6 cluster model, it has been found that the charge-transfer energy Delta is similar to 1 eV and the Ni 3d and O 2p orbitals are strongly hybridized in the ground state. From the cluster-model calculation, the magnetic moment of Ni 3d is estimated to be similar to 0.9 mu(B), which is close to the ionic value of Ni3+ and in good agreement with that obtained from neutron-diffraction experiments. Using the electronic-structure parameters deduced from the cluster-model analysis, we have performed unrestricted Hartree-Fock calculations on a Ni 3d-O 2p perovskite-type lattice model in order to study the effect of GdFeO3-type distortion on the orbital polarization and band gap.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,DEPT APPL PHYS,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.

TI EFFECT OF PRESSURE ON THE MAGNETIC-SUSCEPTIBILITY IN SPIN-PEIERLS
   CUPRATE, CUGEO3
SO SOLID STATE COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
DE MAGNETICALLY ORDERED MATERIALS; PHASE TRANSITIONS; STRAIN, HIGH PRESSURE
ID (TMTTF)2PF6; TRANSITION
AB AC susceptibility and magnetic balance measurements have been performed on a single crystalline CuGeO3 under high pressure up to 8 GPa and 1.1 GPa, respectively. The spin-Peierls (SP) transition temperature (T-SP) increases linearly with increasing pressure ata rate of 4.8 K/GPa. Curie-Weiss fitting was made for the susceptibility above TSP Ferromagnetic transition was observed above 4.5 GPa at around 10 K.

TI MU-SR STUDIES ON SPIN-PEIERLS SYSTEM CU1-XZNXGEO3 (X=0, 0.01, 1.03, AND
   0.07)
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE MU-SR; SPIN-PEIERLS TRANSITION; SPIN GLASS TRANSITION; CUGEO3
ID TRANSITION; CUGEO3
AB The zero-field and the longitudinal field spin-relaxations of positive muon (mu(+)) were measured in Cu1-xZnxGeO3 (x=0, 0.01, 0.03, and 0.07) to study the spin-Peierls system. The obtained relaxation functions were separated into two components below T-SP in CuGeO3. We conclude that the fast relaxation is originated from a few CU2+ spins being not coupled with spin-singlet state, and that the slow relaxation is due to the nuclear dipolar fields. The fast relaxation function shape changes to the Gaussian at 5 K in the sample of x=0.07. The system changes from the static diluted to the densed one. We also confirmed the appearances of the spin-glass-like relaxations at 5 K in the samples of x=0.03 and 0.07.
C1 UNIV TOKYO,FAC SCI,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 113,JAPAN.
RP SOHMA, A (reprint author), AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC-PROPERTIES OF (SR,BA)(2)CU3O4CL2 - 2-DIMENSIONAL
   ANTIFERROMAGNETIC CUPRATES CONTAINING 2 TYPES OF CU-SITE
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference XXXXI/International Conference on Neutron Scattering
   (ICNS 94)
CY OCT 11-14, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
AB Magnetization and neutron-diffraction measurements have been performed on single crystals of Ba2Cu3O4Cl2 and Sr2Cu3O4Cl2, isomorphous layered insulating cuprates containing two types of Cu-site in the Cu3O4 planes. Neutron-diffraction measurements revealed both three-dimensional antiferromagnetic order of Cu2+ spins on one of the sites (A-site), which are connected by the Cu(A)-O-Cu(A) 180 degrees-bonds, and successive order of the other site (B-site), which locates at the centre of the Cu(A)O-2 square. Magnetization measurements indicate an in-plane weak ferromagnetic moment below the Ni el temperature T-N due to spin canting within the Cu3O4 planes.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI 2-DIMENSIONAL DIFFRACTION PATTERNS OF ERFE2O4-DELTA
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference XXXXI/International Conference on Neutron Scattering
   (ICNS 94)
CY OCT 11-14, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
AB Diffraction patterns in the (h h l) plane of ErFe2O4-delta, measured as a function of temperature, show the two-dimensional spin (ferrimagnetic)-charge ordering of Fe2+ and Fe3+ with weak correlations between the planes. A model recently proposed for this spin-charge ordering has been examined by measurements of the intensity for three different crystal directions in the c-plane, since the model leads to the existence of three kinds of domain with quite different volumes. In contrast to this expectation, the results show no appreciable intensity differences.

TI INTERLAYER CORRELATION OF FE SPINS AND CHARGES IN THE 2-D TRIANGULAR
   FERRIMAGNET ERFE2O4
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference XXXXI/International Conference on Neutron Scattering
   (ICNS 94)
CY OCT 11-14, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
ID ANTIFERROMAGNET; MOSSBAUER
AB Neutron polarization analysis was applied to Bragg lines at (1/3, 1/3, l) and (2/3, 2/3, l) of an ErFe2O4 single crystal at 15 K. The magnetic scattering intensity is composed of three sinusoidal curves, corresponding to the spin correlations between next-nearest-neighbor Fe-Fe or Fe-Er layers. The correlation length along the c-axis is only about 8 Angstrom, in contrast to 50 Angstrom in the c-plane. The nuclear part of the scattering indicates correlation of atomic displacements up to about 50 Angstrom along the c-axis, independent of the spin ordering.

TI MAGNETIC EXCITATIONS IN CUGEO3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference XXXXI/International Conference on Neutron Scattering
   (ICNS 94)
CY OCT 11-14, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
ID SPIN
AB In the inorganic spin-Peierls compound CuGeO3, we found a pronounced anisotropic magnetic energy dispersion, i.e. intra-chain exchange J(c) approximate to 10.4meV, inter-chain exchanges J(b) approximate to 0.1J(c), and J(a) approximate to -0.01J(c) and gap energy 2.1meV extrapolated to T = O K. We also observed critical scattering at (0,1,1/2) above T-sp. The ratio of the correlation lengths xi(c)/xi(b) is in good agreement with that obtained from X-ray scattering at (1/2,1,1/2) by Pouget et al. This fact suggests that the Cu2+ spins fluctuate to form singlet-pair short-range order, but not to form ordinary antiferromagnetic order above T-sp.

TI CHARACTERIZATION OF THE SPIN-PEIERLS GAP IN CUGEO3 BY MEANS OF INELASTIC
   NEUTRON-SCATTERING
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Yamada Conference XXXXI/International Conference on Neutron Scattering
   (ICNS 94)
CY OCT 11-14, 1994
CL SENDAI, JAPAN
SP Yamada Sci Fdn
AB The magnetic-field dependence of the spin-Peierls gap in a CuGeO3 single crystal has been studied by means of inelastic neutron scattering with and without polarization analysis. We have clarified the excitonic nature of the singlet-triplet transition in the spin-Peierls system.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN (CA, NA)(2)CACU2O4CL2 - THE NEW SIMPLEST
   DOUBLE-LAYER CUPRATE WITH APICAL CHLORINE
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CA3CU2O4CL2
AB A new superconductor, (Ca,Na)(2)CaCu2O4Cl2 (T-c = 49 K), with apical chlorines synthesized under high pressure has been found by resistivity and magnetization measurements. An X-ray powder diffraction study shows that the phase has a tetragonal structure with a = 3.85 Angstrom c = 21.45 Angstrom, and it has the so called La2CaCu2O6 (2126) type structure with the apical site of pyramidal CuO5 being occupied by the chlorine atoms.

TI ULTRASONIC INVESTIGATION OF A 2-DIMENSIONAL TRIANGULAR LATTICE
   FERRIMAGNET, ERFE2O4-DELTA SINGLE-CRYSTAL
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE ULTRASONIC INVESTIGATION; 2-DIMENSIONAL TRIAGULAR FERRIMAGNET;
   ERFE3O4-DELTA; PULSE-ECHO METHOD
ID ANTIFERROMAGNET; MAGNETIZATION; TRANSITION; MOSSBAUER; PRESSURE;
   LUFE2O4; YFE2O4; RFE2O4
AB Velocities and attenuations of longitudinal sound waves were measured at 100 MHz for a single crystal of non-stoichiometric ErFe2O4-delta, along the [0, 0, 1] and [1, 1, 0] axes in the hexagonal frame, below 300 K. At room temperature, velocities were 5.22 x 10(3) and 5.49 x 10(3) m/s along the [0, 0, 1] and [1, 1, 0] axes, respectively. These values correspond to the elastic constants of C-11 = 1.94 x 10(12) dyne/cm(2) and C-33 = 1.75 x 10(12) dyne/cm(2). Slight softening was disclosed along the [0, 0, 1] axis at around 240 K. Correspondingly, a large peak was observed in the attenuation. These anomalies are attributed to the emergence of two-dimensional spin ordering in this crystal at this temperature. On the contrary, no anomaly was detected along the [1, 1, 0] axis at around 240 K, with rather high attenuation level almost independent of temperature. This absence of anomalies was discussed on the existence of three kinds of magnetic domains. Development of the correlation of Er spins was suggested below 30 K.

TI ANISOTROPY OF DIELECTRIC-DISPERSION IN ERFE2O4 SINGLE-CRYSTAL
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE RFE(2)O(4); ERFE2O4; DIELECTRIC RELAXATION; VERWEY TRANSITION;
   FERROELECTRIC DOMAIN; MAGNETIC DOMAIN
AB Dielectric dispersion was observed in a single crystal with the composition of ErFe2O3.95, below magnetic transition temperature. It is characterized by a large dielectric constant of the order of 10(4), and a Debye-type frequency dependence like in the polycrystalline samples of the same substance which we reported in a previous paper. Large anisotropy exists in the strength epsilon S - epsilon(infinity) and the characteristic relaxation frequency of the dispersion. The strength is higher within the c-plane than along the c-axis, while the characteristic frequency is much larger along the c-axis than within the c-pIane. The dielectric dispersion in the polycrystalline sample cannot be explained by a simple average of the single crystal results. The observed dispersion is qualitatively discussed with a model of domain wall motion on an assumption that ErFe2O4 is a polar crystal.

TI INELASTIC NEUTRON-SCATTERING STUDY OF THE LATTICE-DYNAMICS IN CUGEO3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article
ID SPIN-PEIERLS TRANSITION; PHONON-DISPERSION; TTF; SYSTEM; TCNQ
AB Inelastic neutron scattering study has been performed on various phonon branches of CuGeO3, single crystal. The coupling mode between LA and LO branches along the [001] direction was observed near 23 meV at (0, 0, 2.2) position. Anomalous broad scattering with a peak near 21 meV and FWHM about 20 meV was measured on the line between (0, 0, 2.3) and (0, 0, 2.5). TO phonon branch along the [001] direction becomes softer near zone center but the energy is independent of temperature.

TI INTERLAYER SPIN CORRELATION IN A 2-D TRIANGULAR FERRIMAGNET ERFE2O4
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism - ICM 94 (13th IUPAP Triennial
   Conference on Magnetism)
CY AUG 22-26, 1994
CL WARSAW, POLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
ID ANTIFERROMAGNET; MOSSBAUER
AB Neutron polarization analysis was carried out for Bragg lines at (1/3, 1/3, l) and (2/3, 2/3, l) of an ErFe2O4 single crystal at 15 K. Magnetic part of the intensity was analyzed as a sum of three sinusoidal curves. Correlation length of spins along the c axis is only up to about 8 Angstrom or 1/3 of the unit cell.

TI ESR STUDY OF HIGH AND LOW-FIELD PHASES OF SPIN-PEIRLS SYSTEM CUGEO3
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism - ICM 94 (13th IUPAP Triennial
   Conference on Magnetism)
CY AUG 22-26, 1994
CL WARSAW, POLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
ID EPR
AB Submillimeter wave ESR of CuGeO3 has been performed. The resonances from both spin-Peierls (SP) and magnetic (M) phases have been observed in the 370 GHz band, and our results suggest different g-values for both phases. The temperature dependence of ESR from uniform (U) to SP phases also showed g-shift. The origin of these g-shifts is discussed.

TI STRUCTURAL EVOLUTION OF SPIN-PEIERLS MATERIAL CUGEO3 STUDIED BY
   NEUTRON-SCATTERING
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Magnetism - ICM 94 (13th IUPAP Triennial
   Conference on Magnetism)
CY AUG 22-26, 1994
CL WARSAW, POLAND
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS
AB The crystal structure and phonon dynamics of the spin-Peierls material CuGeO3 have been studied by neutron scattering. We found a large lattice anomaly in the a-b plane, perpendicular to the one-dimensional antiferromagnetic spin chain, above the transition temperature. The phonon modes at 100 meV, of the chain oxygens, show anomalous behavior, consistent with structural change. We therefore conclude that the structural evolution of the chain oxygens in the a-b plane, which mediates the spin-spin interaction along the c-axis, drives the spin-Peierls transition.

TI SYNTHESIS OF OXYCARBONATE SOLID-SOLUTIONS (TL1-XHGX)SR2BA2CU2(CO3)O-Y
   (X=0-1.0) AND SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
AB Solid solution superconductors (Tl-1-x Hg-x)Sr2Ba2Cu2(CO3)O-y were synthesized for x= 0-1.0. The crystal structures, especially its superstructure and superconducting properties, were examined by X-ray powder diffraction, electron microscopy, resistivity and susceptibility measurements. The three different crystallographic phases have been observed; Phases I and II have an 8 times commensurate and 7.5 times incommensurate crystal structure and their propagation vector is along [010]. Phase III has a 4.7-4.5 times incommensurate structure along the [110] direction. The discontinuous change at about x=0.7-0.8 is due to the oxygen deficiency with increasing Hg content. T-c also suddenly dropped from 70 to 60 K at about x=0.7-0.8.

DT Article
DE ERFE2O4; VERWEY TRANSITION; DIELECTRIC RELAXATION; ELECTRON HOPPING; 2
   DIMENSIONAL ANTIFERROMAGNET; RARE-EARTH OXIDE
ID TRIANGULAR LATTICE; PHASE-TRANSITIONS; MOSSBAUER; YFE2O4
AB We report the frequency and the temperature dependence of the dielectric constant of polycrystalline ErFe2O4-delta with different degrees of oxygen deficiency delta. A large dielectric relaxation, with the order of magnitude of 10(4) and nearly of the Debye type, is observed in the magnetically ordered states within the temperature and frequency ranges of 150 K to 290 K and 1 kHz to 3 MHz, respectively. The dispersion is larger in the sample with more oxygen deficiency. From the temperature dependence of the characteristic frequency, we conclude that the elementary process of the dispersion is related to electron hopping between Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions. A large value of the dielectric constant is consistent with the existence of spontaneous polarization in the magnetic phases of this oxide. We propose that the motion of the polarization domain boundaries is a determining factor of low-frequency dielectric constant.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.
   OSAKA UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TOYONAKA,OSAKA 560,JAPAN.

TI SUPERCONDUCTING ENERGY GAPS IN YBA2CU3O7 AND BI2SR2CACU2O8
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
AB We report tunneling measurements of the superconducting energy gaps in YBa2Cu3O7 and Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8 using break junctions. The differential conductance dI/dV at T = 4.2 K shows no leakage around zero bias, while the gap-edge peaks in dI/dV are somewhat broadened compared to the simple BCS density of states. This strongly suggests an s-wave superconductivity with an anisotropic gap. From the best data, we obtain a result that the gap anisotropy in Bi2Sr2CaCu2O8 is larger than that in YBa2Cu3O7.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI SUPERCONDUCTING ENERGY-GAP IN YNI2B2C
SO PHYSICA C-SUPERCONDUCTIVITY AND ITS APPLICATIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT International Conference on Materials and Mechanisms of
   Superconductivity - High Temperature Superconductors IV (M2S-HTSC IV)
CY JUL 05-09, 1994
CL GRENOBLE, FRANCE
SP EUROPEAN COMMUNITY, MINIST EDUC & SCI, FRANCE, CNRS, FRENCH NATL CTR SCI RES, RHONE ALPES REG, CITY GRENOBLE
AB The first tunneling measurements of the superconducting energy gap in YNi2B2C have been carried out. Observed energy gap value is typically 2 Delta(pp) = 5.3 +/- 0.1 meV from the peak-to-peak amplitude in dl/dV, while 2 Delta = 3.7 +/- 0.1 meV is determined from the standard analysis using the BCS theory. Since the T-c measured from the tunnel junction is 12 K, the ratio 2 Delta/k(B)T(c) = 3.5 +/- 0.1 is obtained. This is in good agreement with the BCS prediction, indicating that the superconducting mechanism in this compound is a conventional type.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI RAMAN-SCATTERING OF CUGEO3
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE RAMAN SCATTERING; SPIN-PEIERLS TRANSITION; CUGEO3 PHONON; MAGNETIC
   EXCITATION; POLARIZATION DEPENDENCE
ID SPIN-PEIERLS TRANSITION
AB Polarization and temperature dependence of Raman scattering spectra of CuGeO3 has been measured from room temperature to 5 K. The observed phonons at room temperature are well assigned by the group theoretical estimation for Pbmm(D-2h(5)). The qualitative change for all possible Raman scattering spectra has not been found from room temperature to 14 K. The energy of the five inter-chain phonons increases with decreasing temperature. Below spin-Peierls transition temperature T-sp( 14 K), five peaks at 27, 107, 230, 370, and 820 cm(-1) have been observed for the (c, c) geometry while the peaks at 370 and 820 cm(-1) appear for (b, c).

TI A NEW HOMOLOGOUS SERIES OF OXYCARBONATE SUPERCONDUCTORS
   SR2(CA,SR)N-1CUN(CO3)1-X(BO3)XOY (N=1, 2 AND 3)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CU-O SYSTEM; CARBON; 110-K
AB A new homologous series of oxycarbonate superconductors Sr2(Ca,Sr)n-1Cu(n)(CO3)1-x(BO3)xO(y) (n = 1, 2 and 3) prepared under high pressure have been found by resistivity and magnetization measurements.  X-ray powder diffraction and HRTEM studies show that these phases have tetragonal structures with a = 3.86 angstrom and c = 7.40 angstrom for n = 1, a = 3.86 angstrom and c = 10.62 angstrom for n = 2, and a = 3.87 angstrom and c = 13.98 angstrom for n = 3.  Resistivity and magnetization measurements revealed that superconducting transition temperatures were 50, 105 and 115 K for n = 1-3, respectively.  These T(c)'s are higher than those of the structurally related analogous TIBa2Ca(n-1)Cu(n)O2n + 3 at 110 K (n = 2 and 3).

TI TUNNELING STUDIES ON BA1-XKXBIO3 SINGLE-CRYSTALS WITH T(C)=15-30-K
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID SUPERCONDUCTING BA1-XKXBIO3; SYSTEM; SPECTROSCOPY; DENSITY; STATES
AB Tunneling measurements have been performed on high-quality Ba1-xKxBiO3 single crystals with Tc's between 15 and 30 K.  The junctions are Ba1-xKxBiO3/natural barrier/Au sandwich type, which exhibit very low leakage currents at zero bias and sharp conductance peaks at the gap-edges.  The average ratio of 2DELTA/k(B)T(C) = 3.5 +/- 0.1 is obtained using more than 20 different junctions (different samples) with T(C)'s determined from tunnel junctions.  Temperature dependence of the energy gap is consistent with the BCS prediction.  Second derivative measurements of current-voltage characteristics have also been carried out.  Observed strengths and peak positions of the superconducting phonon structures in d2I/dV2 strongly support phonon-mediated superconductivity in Ba1-xKxBiO3.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,COLL SCI & ENGN,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.
   HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI,HIROSHIMA 724,JAPAN.

TI HIGH-FIELD ESR OF THE SPIN-PEIERLS SYSTEM CUGEO3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT Todai 1993 International Symposium/4th ISSP International Symposium on
   Frontiers in High Magnetic Fields
CY NOV 10-12, 1993
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP UNIV TOKYO, INST SOLID STATE PHYS, UNIV TOKYO
HO UNIV TOKYO
ID TRANSITION; EPR
AB Submillimeter wave ESR measurements of single crystal CuGeO3, which has recently been found as the first inorganic compound which shows a spin-Peierls transition, have been performed in the frequency region from 90 to 380 GHz using a pulsed magnetic field up to 16 T.  The temperature dependences of the intensity and the line width in the temperature range from 4.2 to 300 K have been observed and these results will be discussed in connection with the well-known organic spin-Peierls system.
C1 KOBE UNIV,FAC SCI,DEPT PHYS,NADA KU,KOBE 657,JAPAN.
   AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI PHONON STRUCTURES IN TUNNELING CONDUCTANCE OF SUPERCONDUCTING YBA2CU3O7
SO JOURNAL OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
LA English
DT Article
DE TUNNELING CONDUCTANCE; 2ND DERIVATIVE; PHONON STRUCTURE; YBA2CU3O7
AB We report on measurements of the tunneling conductance structures above the superconducting gap energy using YBa2Cu3O7 polycrystalline junctions. The measured second derivative data are reproducible among the junctions, and the intensities of the common structures at the biases of 37-38, 47-53, 67-77, and 94-95 mV are strong enough to be assigned. These structures are in agreement with those in the neutron phonon density of states in whole energy regions when the energies are measured from the gap edge of 26 +/- 1 meV. This correspondence indicates that the electron-phonon interaction contributes to the pairing mechanism of this superconductor.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.
RP EKINO, T (reprint author), HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI,HIROSHIMA 724,JAPAN.

TI PHONON RAMAN-SCATTERING OF R2CUO4 (R=PR, ND, SM, AND GD)
SO JOURNAL OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
LA English
DT Article
DE RAMAN SCATTERING; T'-STRUCTURE; LOCAL DISTORTION; PHONON
ID CRYSTALS; GD2CUO4
AB For Gd2CuO4, a new symmetry-forbidden phonon for the tetragonal T' structure is observed. This implies that oxygen in the CuO2 plane is locally distorted along the CuO2 plane. Such distortion has never been observed for other T-type superconductors, which show superconductivity by Ce doping. The disappearance of superconductivity for Gd can be correlated with the appearance of the distortion due to oxygen in the CuO2 plane.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,COLL SCI & ENGN,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.
RP UDAGAWA, M (reprint author), HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI,HIROSHIMA 724,JAPAN.

TI NEW HG BASED OXYCARBONATE SUPERCONDUCTOR HGBA2SR2CU2O6+DELTA(CO3)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE; SR2CUO2(CO3)
AB A new Hg based oxycarbonate superconductor HgBa2Sr2Cu2O6+delta(CO3) has been found by resistivity and magnetization measurements. The superconductivity has been observed at 66 K by magnetization measurement. The electron-diffraction and HRTEM studies show that the crystal structure basically consisted of [HgBa2O2+delta] and [Sr2CO3] block layers and has a tetragonal unit cell, with a = 3.88 angstrom, c= 16,94 angstrom, with an orthorhombic superstructure, with A approximately 4.5 square-root a = 24.71 angstrom, B approximately square-root 2a = 5.49 angstrom, C = c = 16.94 angstrom, due to the three times periodic replacements of a CO3 block for HgO(delta) in the same c-planes or to a c/2 shift approximately at intervals of three tetragonal cells along the (110) direction. The crystal structure of this compound is described by the following combination: [(Hg0.5C0.5) (Ba,Sr)2O2.5+delta]+CuO2+[(Ba,Sr)2(C0.5Hg0.5)O2.5+delta+CuO2.
C1 NAT INST RES INORGAN MAT,IBARAGIG 305,JAPAN.
   AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI A NEW FAMILY OF SUPERCONDUCTORS CONTAINING CARBONATE GROUP
SO JOURNAL OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
LA English
DT Article
DE SR2CUO2(CO3)1-X(BO3)X; CAN(CA,SR)2CUN+1(CO3)OY (N=1, 2, 3);
   HGBA2SR2CU2-(CO3)O6+DELTA; COPPER OXYCARBONATE, COPPER OXYBORATE
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE; SR2CUO2(CO3); COMPOUND
AB Three new oxycarbonate superconductors recently obtained in our laboratory are described. (1) Sr2CuO2(CO3)1-x(BO3)x (T(c) = 35 K) was synthesized under ambient pressure, providing a new method for carrier doping on the layered copper oxycarbonate system. (2) Ca(n)(Ca, Sr)2Cun+1(CO3)Oy (n = 1, 2, 3) was synthesized under high pressure. Superconductivity was achieved by substituting (BO3)3- for a part of (CO3)2-. (3) A new Hg system HgBa2Sr2Cu2(CO3)O6+delta was synthesized. T(c) obtained from the magnetic susceptibility is about 66 K.

TI STRUCTURE REFINEMENTS OF ORTHORHOMBIC (LA1-XCAX)2CUO4 (X=0.05)
SO JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
DE (LA1-XCAX)2CUO; NEUTRON POWDER DIFFRACTION; CRYSTAL STRUCTURE
ID SUPERCONDUCTIVITY; LA2-XSRXCUO4-DELTA; DIFFRACTION; PRESSURE; TC; BA; SR
AB The structure parameters of (La1-xCax)2CuO4 (x=0.05) with the K2NiF4-type structure were refined by Rietveld analysis of time-of-flight neutron powder diffraction data. This superconductor with a T(c) of 24 K is orthorhombic at both room temperature and 18 K. From experimental results obtained by us and Fukuoka et al., we conclude that the relatively low T(c) value for the superconductor is due to a low concentration of hole carriers introduced by Ca doping.
C1 NATL INST RES INORGAN MAT,SAKURA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI INFRARED-ABSORPTION OF ND2-XCEXCUO4 AND R2CUO4 (R=PR, ND, SM, AND GD)
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB Infrared absorption spectra of Nd2-xCe(x)CuO4 and R2CuO4 (R = Pr, Nd, Sm, and Gd) have been measured in the energy region between 250 and 800 cm-1 at room temperature.  For Nd2-xCe(x)CuO4, it is found that the mode at about 350cm-1, which is the vibration of oxygen in the R-O layers along the a-axis, disappears both for the as-grown Nd2-xCe(x)CuO4 of x greater-than-or-equal-to 0.08 and for the oxygen-reduced Nd2-xCe(x)CuO4 of x>0, and the disappearance is correlated to the resistivity.  For R2CuO4, it is found that the energy of the A2u symmetry mode, which is the oxygen vibration along the c-axis, increases by about 50cm-1 between Pr to Gd, and this fact suggests that the three dimensional character increases in a sequence of Pr, Nd, Sm, and Gd.
C1 HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC EDUC,HIROSHIMA 724,JAPAN.
   AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,COLL SCI & ENGN,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI CDW TUNNELING DENSITY-OF-STATES IN NBSE3
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
ID CHARGE-DENSITY
AB Charge-density-wave (CDW) density of states in quasi-one-dimensional conductor NbSe3 has been examined using low temperature tunneling conductance.  Most of the CDW gap structures are expressed by the Gaussian distribution model of the BCS gaps.  The two-dimensional anisotropic density of states predicted by Huang and Maki also fits to some of the data.  Furthermore we observed the conductance having the perfect zero value at zero bias.  These results suggest that the CDW gap in NbSe3 is spatially varied or being anisotropic.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN NB1-XTAXSE3
   (0.14-LESS-THAN-OR-EQUAL-TO-X-LESS-THAN-OR-EQUAL-TO-0.16)
SO PHYSICA B
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 20th International Conference on Low Temperature Physics
CY AUG 04-11, 1993
CL EUGENE, OR
SP INT UNION PURE & APPL PHYS, AMER PHYS SOC, CITY EUGENE, INT INST REFRIGERAT, INT SCI FDN, JET PROPULS LABS, NATL SCI FDN, USN, OFF NAVAL RES, OXFORD INSTRUMENTS INC, TEKTRONIX INC, UNIV OREGON
AB We report on resistivity and susceptibility measurements of the superconducting Nb1-xTaxSe3 single crystals with 0.14 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 0.16. Its crystal structure is the same as that of NbSe3 and the highest T(c) is 6 K at x = 0.15. The measurements of the upper critical field H(c2) revealed the quasi two-dimensional nature and the angular dependence of H(c2) is consistent with the anisotropic effective mass model.

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITIONS IN (PR2-XCEX)CUO4-DELTA
SO HYPERFINE INTERACTIONS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 6th International Conference on Muon Spin Rotation/Relaxation/Resonance
CY MAY 31-JUN 11, 1993
CL MAUI, HI
ID SPIN CORRELATIONS; ND2CUO4; PR2CUO4
AB We report muSR measurements of PrCuO4-delta and (Pr2-xCex)CuO4-delta single crystals in the temperature range 4.2K-300K. Two spin reorientation phase transitions were observed, although neutron scattering experiment could not detect these phase transitions. These allow us to conclude that magnetic moments of the Cu atoms order in an antiferromagnetic noncollinear cross like structure including a hidden canting spin arrangement.
C1 TOKYO INST TECHNOL,DEPT PHYS,MEGURO KU,TOKYO 152,JAPAN.
   UNIV TOKYO,MESON SCI LAB,BUNKYO KU,TOKYO 103,JAPAN.

TI SYNTHESIS AND SUPERCONDUCTIVITY OF OXYCARBONATES OF THE TL-1201 PHASE
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID COMPOUND
AB TlBaxSr4-xCu2(CO3)Oy oxycarbonates with the Tl-1201 structure were synthesized over a wide range of x (1.0 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 3.2) and examined by X-ray powder diffraction, electron diffraction, high-resolution electron microscopy and magnetometry methods. New phases with the Tl-1201 structure having 6 and 7 times periodicities along the b-axis were isolated. The former was stable for a wide Ba-rich range (1.8 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 3.2), and the latter was observed for a smaller Ba content range (1.2 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to  1.6). The phase stability was found to depend on the synthesis condition. The maximum T(c) of the as-synthesized specimen in this series occurred at about 70 K around x = 2.0. The Meissner volume fraction of the as-synthesized specimen (x = 2.4) was 30% at 5 K.

TI RAMAN-SCATTERING STUDY OF R2CUO4 (R=PR, ND, SM, AND GD)
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID LOCAL STRUCTURAL-CHANGE; PHONON; ND2-XCEXCUO4-Y; STABILITY; CRYSTALS; TC
AB For Gd2CuO4, a symmetry-forbidden phonon for the tetragonal T' structure is observed. This shows that oxygen in the CuO2 plane is locally distorted along the plane. Such distortion has not been observed for other T'-type superconductors. The normal-mode calculation shows that the correlation between the CuO2 plane and R-O layers increases with decreasing ionic radius. The increased three-dimensional character and the appearance of the distortion of O in the CuO2 plane along the a axis are useful experimental results that help clarify the mechanism that causes the disappearance of superconductivity for Gd.

TI SUPERCONDUCTING ENERGY GAPS IN BI2SR2CUO6+Y AND BI2SR2-XNDXCUO6+Y
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CU-O SYSTEM; TUNNELING SPECTROSCOPY; CRITICAL-TEMPERATURE;
   SINGLE-CRYSTALS; TRANSITION; OXIDE; PR; ND; LA
AB Superconducting energy gaps in Bi2Sr2-xNdxCuO6+y (0 less-than-or-equal-to x less-than-or-equal-to 0.7) with T(c) = 6.5-20 K have been studied by the electron tunneling technique. The smallest gap value was found at +/-2 meV for x = 0 with T(c) = 6.5 K. The obtained pp values almost scale with x and thus T(c) throughout the superconducting phase. The ratio 2DELTA(peak)/k(B)T(c) = 7.1 (2DELTA/k(B)T(c) = 4-5 with DELTA from the BCS analysis) for the sample with T(c) = 6.5 K is still larger than the BCS ratio 3.5 of non-copper oxides (BaPb0.75Bi0.25O3 and Li1+xTi2-xO4) with T(c) = 11-12 K, indicating a substantial pairing nature difference between them.

TI INCOMMENSURATE AND COMMENSURATE SUPERSTRUCTURES IN THE OXYCARBONATE
   SUPERCONDUCTOR TLSR4-XBAXCU2(CO3)O-Y(X-APPROXIMATE-TO-2)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE
AB Superstructures of oxycarbonate superconductor TlSr4-xBaxCu2(CO3)O-y(x=2; T-c=73 K) were examined by electron diffraction and HRTEM techniques. Part of the crystals show a commensurate superstructure with a 6a(0) periodicity due to crystallographic shears by c/2 to form -(C-C-C)-(Tl-Tl-Tl)-(C-C-C)-(Tl-Tl-Tl)- type of sequences along the (100) direction in the basal planes. Incommensurate superstructures with longer periodicities up to 7.4a(0) due to mixed intergrowths of-(C-C-C-C)- and -(C-C-C)- sequences were also observed. The average superstructure periodicity of the present specimen is around 7a(0), which is relatively shorter than the value of 8a(0) previously claimed by Goutenoire et al. [Physica C210 (1993) 359] for a similar superconductor with T-c=62 K. This suggests the possibility of a close relationship between the modulation periodicity and the transition temperature in the TlSr4-xBaxCu2(CO3)O-y system with x=1-2.5. Observed structures were compared with an another type of superstructure recently discovered in HgBa2Sr2Cu2(CO3)O-y by Uehara et al.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN THE NEW COMPOUND SR2CUO2(CO3)1-X(BO3)X - THE NEW
   METHOD FOR CARRIER DOPING ON LAYERED COPPER-OXYCARBONATES
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE
AB A new copper oxide superconductor containing carbon and boron Sr2CuO2(CO3)1-x(BO3)x WaS synthesized under ambient pressure.  The superconducting transition was observed for the samples with x = 0.15 and 0.2.  The highest T(c) (approximately 32 K) determined by magnetization measurements was obtained for the sample with x = 0. 1 5. The X-my Rietveld analysis of this compound can be characterized by the tetragonal symmetry (I4BAR) with a = 0. 77881 (15) nm and c = 1.49681 (3) nm (x = 0. 1 5). The crystal structure determination suggests that the crystal structure is basically the same as that of Sr2CuO2 (CO3).

TI SUPERCONDUCTING PHASE IN NB1-XTAXSE3 (0.135-LESS-THAN-X-LESS-THAN-0.16)
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW B
LA English
DT Article
ID CHARGE-DENSITY WAVES; ELECTRIC-FIELD; NBSE3; PRESSURE; TASE3
AB We have found a superconducting phase in single-crystal Nb1-xTaxSe3 with 0.135 < x < 0.16 by use of resistivity and susceptibility measurements. Its crystal structure is identical to that of NbSe3, and the superconductivity occurs between x = 0.135 and 0.16, a much higher tantalum concentration than that of the known phase with x = 0.02-0.08. The highest superconducting transition temperature T(c) is obtained as 5.8 K at x = 0.148, well beyond the T(c) = 1.5 K of Nb0.95Ta0.05Se3.  Measurements of the upper critical field H(c2) revealed its quasi-two-dimensional nature and the angular dependence of H(c2) is described by an anisotropic effective-mass model, which shows the intrinsic anisotropy of the electron band mass. The superconducting energy gap has been measured with an electron-tunneling technique and the observed gap values are discussed on the basis of the BCS theory.

   HIROSHIMA UNIV,FAC INTEGRATED ARTS & SCI,HIROSHIMA 724,JAPAN.
   UNIV TSUKUBA,INST GEOSCI,TSUKUBA 305,JAPAN.

TI PRESSURE-INDUCED SUCCESSIVE MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITIONS IN PR2CUO4-Y
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID SPIN CORRELATIONS; ND2CUO4
AB The effects of pressure on the antiferromagnetic long-range ordering in Pr2CuO4-y have been studied between 0.25 and 0.75 GPa by neutron diffraction experiments at temperatures down to 12 K. Under a pressure of 0.25 GPa, successive magnetic phase transitions are observed at T(N) almost-equal-to 250 K and T1 almost-equal-to 170 K, as was reported previously. Upon further cooling in the present experiments another transition has been found at T2 almost-equal-to 50 K. These magnetic phase transitions can be attributed to spin reorientations induced under high pressure. The temperature T1 increases at a rate of about 40 K/GPa with pressure; on the other hand, T2 decreases greatly at -120 K/GPa.
C1 OAK RIDGE NATL LAB,DIV SOLID STATE,OAK RIDGE,TN 37831.
   UNIV TOKYO,INST SOLID STATE PHYS,MINATO KU,TOKYO 106,JAPAN.
   AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITIES IN THE (BI,PB)-OXYCARBONATE SYSTEM
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE
AB Two (Bi,Pb)-oxycarbonate superconductors have been found by resistivity and magnetization measurements. Transition temperatures are 41 K (54 K) for the low-T(c) phase (high-T(c) phase). The crystal structures were analyzed by using the HRTEM and X-ray diffraction techniques. The lattice parameters were a0 = 3.821 angstrom, c0 = 39.444 angstrom (a0 = 3.88 angstrom, c0 = 54.52 angstrom) for low-T(c) phase (high-T(c) phase) in the tetragonal unit cell.
   A crystal structure model is proposed in which the chemical formula for the low-T(c) phase (high-T(c) phase) is (Bi,Pb)2Sr4Cu2CO3O8 ((Bi,Pb)2Sr6Cu3(CO3)2O10), which can be described as the combination of a single (double) Sr2CO3 block and a single (Bi,Pb)2Sr2O4 block.

TI SELECTIVE PLASMA OXIDATION OF OXYGEN-DEFICIENT YBA2CU3O7-X
SO JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
ID SUPERCONDUCTING-BASE TRANSISTOR; FILMS
AB A selective plasma oxidation method was developed to make superconducting patterns in nonsuperconducting deoxygenated          YBa2Cu3O7-x   (YBCO)      films.    Superconductor-nonsuperconductor-superconductor junctions were fabricated in oxygen-deficient c-axis-oriented polycrystalline YBCO films by selective plasma oxidation using AU/BaF2 oxidation masks. These devices displayed SNS-like or SIN-like nonlinear current-voltage relationships, depending on the device size and oxidation time. The oxygen penetration depth beneath the oxidation mask was estimated to be about 2 mum for the polycrystalline films. Oxygen supplied to 300-nm-thick films for 5 min changes its phase, determined from x-ray diffraction patterns, from tetragonal to orthorhombic I having a critical temperature of about 85 K. X-ray diffraction and magnetic susceptibility measurement showed that the plasma oxidation can supply oxygen to a deoxygenated 0.7 X 0.5 X 0.05 mm YBCO single crystal, changing the entire crystal from tetragonal to the orthorhombic II phase whose critical temperature is about 50 K. Four-probe resistance measurement of the plasma oxidized single crystal showed that the phase of the surface of the sample became orthorhombic I with the critical temperature of 84 K by plasma oxidation.
C1 AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,COLL SCI & ENGN,SETAGAYA KU,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.
RP YOSHIDA, A (reprint author), FUJITSU LTD,10-1 MORINOSATO WAKAMIYA,ATSUGI 24301,JAPAN.

TI HIGH-PRESSURE STUDY ON THE SUPERCONDUCTING TRANSITION-TEMPERATURE AND
   HALL-COEFFICIENT OF BA1-XKXBIO3 UP TO 8-GPA
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID BA0.6K0.4BIO3; SYSTEM
AB The superconducting transition temperature (T(c)) of Ba0.62K0.38Bio3 (T(c) = 30 K) has been measured under high pressure up to 8 GPa. It is observed that T(c) increases initially with pressure, as reported by Uwe et al., Shirber et al. and Huang et al., but decreases above 4 GPa. The Hall coefficient of Ba0.62K0.38BiO3 has been measured up to 1.2 GPa. The absolute value of the Hall coefficient decreases with pressure by 10%/GPa, the value of which is almost the same as that obtained in most CuO-based high-temperature superconductors.

TI SUPERCONDUCTOR WITH TC UP TO 80-K IN THE COMPOUND
   (LN,CA)(SR,BA)2(C,CU)CU2O7-DELTA
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
AB We have synthesized a new family of oxycarbonate compounds (Ln,Ca)(Sr,Ba)2(C,CU)Cu2O7-delta (Ln: rare-earth metals) with a so-called ''CO3-1212'' structure. Two kinds of single phase in the general formula Er0.5Ca0.5Sr2-xBaCu3-yCyO7-delta with (x, y) = (0.6, 0.5) and ( 1.3, 0.4) were prepared at different CO2 partial pressures. The former compound shows a superconducting transition at about 45 K, and the latter has T(c) up to 80 K. This rise in T(c) may come from the increase of carrier density because of the decrease of carbon content. We have also studied the Ln-dependence, and it is revealed that most of the compounds Ln0.5Ca0.5Sr0.7Ba1.3Cu2.6C0.4O7-delta ShoW the same results, except for Ln = Ce and Th, which did not construct the structure, and also Ln = Pr, which shows suppressed superconductivity with T(c) of 30 K.

TI HIGH-T-C SUPERCONDUCTORS BASED ON THE NEW MATERIAL DESIGN
SO PHASE TRANSITIONS
LA English
DT Article
DE BLOCK LAYER; LAYER; CUBIC CU-OXIDE; SR2VO4
AB We review the present status of the oxide superconductors from structural points of view. Tokura has recently introduced the new concept of a ''block'' and found the new material by new combinations of ''blocks''. We propose here the new concept of ''layer'' by classifying the block. We discuss the possibility of the new block by reconstructuring the layer. We can design the new material by constructing the new blocks. Further perspectives on the new high-T-c superconductors of Cu and non-Cu materials are briefly discussed.
RP AKIMITSU, J (reprint author), AOYAMA GAKUIN UNIV,DEPT PHYS,SETAGAYA KU,6-16-1 CHITOSEDAI,TOKYO 157,JAPAN.

TI (C0.35CU0.65)SR2(Y0.73CE0.27)2CU2OX - A NEW SUPERCONDUCTOR CONTAINING
   CO3
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
ID CRYSTAL-STRUCTURE; ND; SR; CE
AB A new "1222"-type compound containing carbonates, (C0.35Cu0.65)Sr2(Y0.73Ce0.27)2Cu2Ox, was synthesized at 1303 K under an atmosphere of 02 (80%)-CO2 (20%) (partial pressure of CO2: PCO2=0.020 MPa). The sample annealed at 1023 K under the high oxygen pressure of 90 MPa has a superconducting transition temperature, T(c), of 18 K and a superconducting volume fraction of about 10% at 5 K. The structure of the superconductor was analyzed using the Rietveld method for the X-ray powder diffraction pattern. The refined lattice parameters were a = 3.8272 (1), b = 3.8 313 (1) and c = 27.707 7 (6) angstrom.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN THE NEW COMPOUND (Y1-XCAX)0.95SR2.05CU2.4(CO3)0.6OY
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article
AB A new Cu-oxide superconductor (Y1-xCax)0.95Sr2.05Cu2.4(CO3)0.6Oy has been found by resistivity and magnetization measurements. The transition temperature is about 63 K. The crystal structure consists of the periodic replacements of the Cu(I) site with a CO3 group in the basic YBa2Cu3Oy structure.

TI THE TIME EVOLUTION OF THE 1ST-ORDER MAGNETIC PHASE-TRANSITION IN
   DY-4-PERCENT-Y ALLOY
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article
AB The first-order magnetic transition of spiral to ferromagnetic structure of Dy-4% Y alloy has been investigated by means of Synchrotron X-ray diffraction. The development of the ferromagnetic phase could be studied by X-ray diffraction measurement for the observation of the hexagonal to orthorhombic crystal distortion accompanying the first-order magnetic transition. Below T(c), the ferromagnetic and spiral phases coexist and the development of the ferromagnetic phase exhibits a time dependent behaviour and is proportional to log t except in the early stage of the phase transition.

TI PHASE-TRANSITION IN LIVO2
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MAGNETISM
CY SEP 02-06, 1991
CL EDINBURGH, SCOTLAND
ID TEMPERATURE
AB The magnetic susceptibility chi and specific heat C(p) were measured for the two-dimensional triangular antiferromagnet LiVO2.  The phase transition was observed between T(t)down = 450 K and T(t)up = 485 K in the chi-result.  The chi showed a reproducible thermal hysteresis between T(t)down and T(t)up.  The entropy change around T(t)up was estimated as about 11 J/K mol from the C(p)-result.  By the cation-exchange chromatography, it was indicated that the chemical formula of the measured sample was Li0.84VO2.

TI SUPERCONDUCTIVITY IN SR(LN)-NB-O SYSTEM (LN-LA,ND,PR,CE,GD AND HO)
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PERFECTURE
AB A new non-Cu oxide superconductor Sr(Ln)-Nb-O system (Ln:La,Nd,Pr,Ce,Gd and Ho) has been found by the resistivity and magnetization measurements.  The highest onset transition temperature is about 12K.  Preliminary electron and X-ray diffraction experiments indicate that main phase (approximately 90%) in this system is (Sr1-xLnx)Nb2O6-delta and another impurity phase (approximately 10%) is (Sr1-xLnx)2Nb2O7-delta, suggesting that the basic crystal structure is probably an oxygen deficient CaTa2O6 type structure.

TI MEASUREMENT OF VERY LOW RESISTIVITY FOR A ROD-SHAPED SUPERCONDUCTOR
SO PHYSICA C
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 3RD INTERNATIONAL CONF ON MATERIALS AND MECHANISMS OF SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTORS
CY JUL 22-26, 1991
CL KANAZAWA, JAPAN
SP CITY KANAZAWA, ISHIKAWA PREFECTURE
AB An effective method for the measurement of the resisitivity (rho) and magnetic susceptibility (chi) of a circular rod-shaped superconductor, in which chi is estimated by substituting the magnetic penetration depth (lambda) into a formula after obtaining from the difference in the impedance between a solenoid coil with a sample and an identical one without a sample, is proposed.  It was shown that, by this method (SRPM method), rho and lambda were precisely measured and it is possible to measure very low resistivity in comparison with conventional dc method.

ID PHASE-TRANSITIONS; YFE2O4
AB Two-dimensional magnetic short-range ordering was observed by neutron diffraction in polycrystalline ErFe2O4 at temperatures where a thermoremanent magnetization is observed but three-dimensional ordering develops at lower temperature.  A slight incommensurate character was observed in the low-temperature diffraction.

TI A NEW NON-CU-OXIDE SUPERCONDUCTOR - (SR1-XLNX)NB2O6-Y(LN-LA, ND, PR AND
   CE)
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
DE NB-OXIDE SUPERCONDUCTOR; CATA2O6-TYPE STRUCTURE
ID SYSTEM
AB A new non-Cu superconductor (Sr1-xLn(x))Nb2O6-y(Ln:  La, Nd, Pr, Ce, Gd and Ho) has been found through resistivity and magnetization measurements.  The highest onset transition temperature is about 12 K.  Preliminary electron and X-ray diffraction experiments indicate that the crystal structure of the system is orthorhombic with a unit cell of a = 11.00 angstrom, b = 7.68 angstrom and c = 5.59 angstrom, suggesting that the basic crystal structure is an oxygen-deficient CaTa2O6-type structure.

TI 2-SPIN SUPEREXCHANGE AND 4-SPIN CYCLIC EXCHANGE INTERACTIONS IN HIGH-TC
   SUPERCONDUCTING CUPRATES AND ISOSTRUCTURAL LA2NIO4
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB Raman spectra in the antiferromagnetic insulator phases of S = 1/2 high T(c) superconducting cuprates were compared with S = 1 La2NiO4.  The anomalous magnon spectra in cuprates suggest that the four-spin cyclic exchange interactions are very large.  The doped carriers in cuprates show non-Fermi liquid behavior.
